org.kepler.provenance

Class FireState<FireIdType>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.kepler.provenance.FireState<FireIdType>

  • public class FireState<FireIdType>
extends java.lang.Object
    A utility class to keep track of an actor's firing.
    Author:
    Daniel Crawl

      • fireStop

        public FireIdType fireStop(FiringEvent.FiringEventType type)
        Record the stop of a firing, and get the fire index for a type of fire.
        Parameters:
        type - the current type of fire that running
        Returns:
        the firing id

      • getCurFireId

        public FireIdType getCurFireId()
        Get the current (non-rw) firing index.

      • getCurFireId

        public FireIdType getCurFireId(boolean wantRWFireId)
        Get the current firing index.
        Parameters:
        wantRWFireId - If true, return current rw fire id, else return current non-rw fire id. In the latter case, it returns the id of the most recent prefire, fire, or postfire to start. If none of those three types of fire are currently running, it returns the id of the currently "iterate" firing. If no "iterate" is currently running, returns UNKNOWN_FIRE_ID.

      • getLastStartFireType

        public FiringEvent.FiringEventType getLastStartFireType()
        Get the last starting firing type seen.

      • getNextStopFiringType

        public FiringEvent.FiringEventType getNextStopFiringType()
                                                  throws RecordingException
        Get the expected firing type for stopping the firing iteration.
        Throws:
        RecordingException

      • getNumberOfFirings

        public int getNumberOfFirings()
        Return the number of firings seen. The number is incremented each time fireStop() is called.

      • getPortLastAccess

        public FireState.PortAccessType getPortLastAccess()
        Get the last port access for the actor.
